comment._content: Daughter of the Speaker of the House (doesn't say if that's Federal or State). Was engaged to James M Thomson of New Orleans in June 1915. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9404EFDA1539E333A...

comment.author: 8137368@N07
comment._content: Everything looks so shiny and high-tech.  Ms. Clark looks as satisfied as anyone being photographed with a new Blackberry, iPhone, or Android a century later.

comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Some Bain trivia: The negative number etched here is 2680-3. You will notice that Miss Clark is sitting at the same desk, using the same telephone as that which sits on the desk of Alben Barkley, adjacent in this photostream, and which also has the consecutive negative number 2680-2: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3294674193/

comment.author: 12660697@N02
comment._content: I love this glimpse (snapshot)  of a women taking herself seriously in a time when it was the exception, not the norm.  (I also love that she is wearing cufflinks!)
